name: Surveillez les changements dynamiques des sites Web avec Firecrawl, Sheets et les alertes Gmail
description:
# üï∏Ô∏è Moniteur de changements dynamiques de sites Web avec alertes par e-mail intelligentes

Ne manquez plus jamais les mises √† jour importantes des sites Web ! Ce flux de travail suit automatiquement les changements sur des sites Web dynamiques (pensez aux applications React, aux sites lourds en JavaScript) et vous envoie des notifications par e-mail instantan√©es lorsque quelque chose change. Parfait pour garder un ≈ìil sur les concurrents, surveiller les mises √† jour de produits ou rester inform√© des annonces importantes.

## ‚ú® Qu'est-ce qui rend cela sp√©cial ?

üöÄ **G√®re les sites Web dynamiques** : Utilise l'API Firecrawl pour extraire le contenu rendu par JavaScript que les scrapers de base ne peuvent pas toucher
üìß **Alertes par e-mail intelligentes** : Envoie des notifications uniquement lorsque le contenu change r√©ellement (pas de spam !)
üìä **Suivi historique** : Conserve un journal complet de tous les changements dans Google Sheets
üõ°Ô∏è **√Ä toute √©preuve** : Continue de fonctionner m√™me si une partie √©choue
‚ö° **Pr√™t √† d√©ployer** : D√©clench√© par webhook, parfait pour les t√¢ches cron ou les planificateurs externes

## üéØ Parfait pour surveiller :
- Pages de tarification des concurrents
- Annonces de tableaux d'emploi
- Mises √† jour de disponibilit√© des produits  
- Sites d'actualit√©s pour des histoires de derni√®re minute
- Changements de documentation API
- Mises √† jour des conditions de service

## üõ†Ô∏è Ce dont vous aurez besoin pour commencer :

### Comptes et cl√©s API :
1. **Compte Firecrawl** üî•
   - Inscrivez-vous sur [firecrawl.dev](https://firecrawl.dev)
   - R√©cup√©rez votre cl√© API depuis le tableau de bord
   - Cr√©ez un identifiant "Bearer Auth" dans n8n

2. **Configuration de Google Cloud** ‚òÅÔ∏è
   - Activez l'API Google Sheets
   - Activez l'API Gmail  
   - Configurez les identifiants OAuth2
   - Ajoutez les deux en tant qu'identifiants dans n8n

3. **Document Google Sheets** üìã
   - Cr√©ez une nouvelle feuille de calcul
   - Ajoutez deux onglets : "Log" et "comparison"
   - Suivez la structure d√©crite dans les notes du flux de travail

## üöÄ Comment cela fonctionne :

1. **Webhook re√ßoit le d√©clencheur** ‚Üí D√©marre le processus de surveillance
2. **Firecrawl extrait le site Web** ‚Üí Obtient du contenu frais (m√™me rendu par JavaScript !)
3. **Comparaison intelligente** ‚Üí V√©rifie par rapport au contenu pr√©c√©demment stock√©
4. **Changement d√©tect√© ?** ‚Üí Si oui, envoyez un e-mail + enregistrez tout
5. **Mettre √† jour le stockage** ‚Üí Pr√©pare pour le prochain cycle de surveillance

## ‚öôÔ∏è √âtapes de configuration :

1. **Importez ce flux de travail** dans votre instance n8n
2. **Configurez les identifiants** pour Firecrawl, Google Sheets et Gmail
3. **Mettez √† jour l'URL cible** dans le n≈ìud Firecrawl
4. **D√©finissez votre adresse e-mail** dans le n≈ìud Gmail
5. **Cr√©ez vos Google Sheets** avec la structure requise
6. **Testez-le manuellement** d'abord, puis activez-le !

## üé® Personnalisez-le √† votre fa√ßon :

- **Ciblez n'importe quel site Web** en mettant √† jour l'URL
- **Changez les mod√®les d'e-mail** pour correspondre √† votre style
- **Ajustez la fr√©quence de surveillance** avec des t√¢ches cron externes
- **Alternez entre les formats d'extraction markdown/HTML**
- **Affinez la sensibilit√© de d√©tection des changements**

## üîß D√©pannage :

- **Erreurs Firecrawl ?** V√©rifiez votre cl√© API et vos limites de taux
- **Probl√®mes Google Sheets ?** V√©rifiez les autorisations OAuth et la structure de la feuille  
- **E-mail non envoy√© ?** V√©rifiez les quotas de l'API Gmail et les dossiers de spam
- **Probl√®mes de webhook ?** Assurez-vous que le flux de travail est activ√©

Pr√™t √† ne plus jamais manquer un autre changement de site Web ? Mettons cette automatisation en marche ! üéâ

nodes.name: Webhook
nodes.notes: Trigger node ‚Äì waits for an HTTP request on /webhook/n8n-challenge and starts the workflow. The final response is supplied by the Respond* nodes.

nodes.name: Firecrawl HTTP Request
nodes.notes: Calls Firecrawl API to scrape the target web page in Markdown and HTML. Uses Bearer-token authentication configured in credentials.

nodes.name: Get Timestamp
nodes.notes: JavaScript Code node ‚Äì attaches a millisecond timestamp to the scraped content (legacy high-port flag kept untouched for compatibility).

nodes.name: Update Current Content
nodes.notes: Writes the freshly scraped content into row 2 of the *comparison* sheet (columns current_timestamp & current_content).

nodes.name: Read Current and Latest Content
nodes.notes: Loads the same row 2, giving us both last_content and current_content for comparison.

nodes.name: Is Equal?
nodes.notes: IF node ‚Äì checks whether the scraped content changed. True branch ‚Üí unchanged, False branch ‚Üí changed.

nodes.name: Respond Unchanged
nodes.notes: Returns a 200 OK response to the original webhook caller when no change was detected.

nodes.name: Read Latest and Latest Content
nodes.notes: Reads the current sheet row again on the ‚Äòchanged‚Äô path so subsequent code nodes have the freshest values.

nodes.name: Extract Differences
nodes.notes: Splits last & current content into arrays, determines new vs missing segments, attaches another timestamp.

nodes.name: Gmail
nodes.notes: Sends a plain-text email detailing what changed (first diff only) to n8nchallenge@we-hang.com.

parameters.message:
=Guten Tag, 

Es gab eine √Ñnderung an der beobachteten Website:

Um "{{ $json.timestamp }}" wurde "{{ $json.missingContent[0] }}" durch "{{ $json.newContent[0] }}" ersetzt.

Viele Gr√º√üe
parameters.subject: Relevante Inhalts√§nderung auf Website

nodes.name: Append Log Row
nodes.notes: Adds a new row to *Log* sheet with timestamp & full current content ‚Äì creates a historical audit trail.

nodes.name: Update Latest Content
nodes.notes: Moves current values into the *last_* columns (row 2) so the next run will compare against them.

nodes.name: Respond Changed
nodes.notes: Returns a success response to the original HTTP call confirming that a change was processed.

parameters.content:
üéØ WORKFLOW PURPOSE:
This workflow monitors a webpage for content changes and sends email notifications when changes are detected.

üìä KEY COMPONENTS:
‚Ä¢ Firecrawl API for web scraping
‚Ä¢ Google Sheets for data storage & comparison
‚Ä¢ Gmail for notifications
‚Ä¢ Webhook trigger for external activation

üîÑ WORKFLOW FLOW:
Webhook ‚Üí Scrape ‚Üí Compare ‚Üí Email (if changed) ‚Üí Log ‚Üí Respond

‚öôÔ∏è REQUIRED CREDENTIALS:

1Ô∏è‚É£ FIRECRAWL API:
‚Ä¢ Sign up at https://firecrawl.dev
‚Ä¢ Get API key from dashboard
‚Ä¢ Create 'Bearer Auth' credential in n8n
‚Ä¢ Name: 'Bearer Auth account'

2Ô∏è‚É£ GOOGLE SHEETS:
‚Ä¢ Enable Google Sheets API in Google Cloud Console
‚Ä¢ Create OAuth2 credentials
‚Ä¢ Add credential in n8n as 'Google Sheets account'

3Ô∏è‚É£ GMAIL:
‚Ä¢ Enable Gmail API in Google Cloud Console
‚Ä¢ Create OAuth2 credentials
‚Ä¢ Add credential in n8n as 'Gmail account'

üìã SPREADSHEET STRUCTURE:

üóÇÔ∏è Create a Google Sheet with 2 tabs:

1Ô∏è‚É£ 'Log' sheet (gid=0):
‚Ä¢ Column A: timestamp
‚Ä¢ Column B: content

2Ô∏è‚É£ 'comparison' sheet (gid=725909638):
‚Ä¢ Column A: last_timestamp
‚Ä¢ Column B: last_content  
‚Ä¢ Column C: current_timestamp
‚Ä¢ Column D: current_content
‚Ä¢ Column E: row_number
‚Ä¢ Row 2: Set 'row_number' to '2'

üìù Copy the spreadsheet ID from the URL and update all Google Sheets nodes with your ID.

üîß CUSTOMIZATION SETTINGS:

üåê TARGET WEBSITE:
‚Ä¢ Update Firecrawl node 'url' parameter

üìß EMAIL SETTINGS:
‚Ä¢ Update Gmail node 'sendTo' field
‚Ä¢ Customize subject and message template

ü™ù WEBHOOK PATH:
‚Ä¢ Can be customized in Webhook node

üìÑ SCRAPING FORMAT:
‚Ä¢ Currently set to markdown + html
‚Ä¢ Modify in Firecrawl node if needed

‚úÖ TESTING STEPS:

1Ô∏è‚É£ MANUAL TEST:
‚Ä¢ Click 'Execute Workflow' button
‚Ä¢ Check if all nodes execute successfully
‚Ä¢ Verify Google Sheets get populated
‚Ä¢ Check if email is sent (if content differs)

2Ô∏è‚É£ WEBHOOK TEST:
‚Ä¢ Activate workflow (toggle switch)
‚Ä¢ Copy webhook URL from Webhook node
‚Ä¢ Test with curl or Postman:
  curl -X POST [your-webhook-url]

3Ô∏è‚É£ TROUBLESHOOTING:
‚Ä¢ Check node execution logs for errors
‚Ä¢ Verify all credentials are properly configured
‚Ä¢ Ensure Google Sheets permissions are correct

‚è∞ SCHEDULING OPTIONS:

üîÑ CRON JOB (Recommended):
‚Ä¢ Set up external cron job to call webhook
‚Ä¢ Example: */30 * * * * (every 30 minutes)
‚Ä¢ Command: curl -X POST [webhook-url]

‚ö° N8N CRON TRIGGER:
‚Ä¢ Replace Webhook with Cron Trigger node
‚Ä¢ Set desired interval
‚Ä¢ Remove Respond nodes (not needed)

üåê EXTERNAL MONITORING:
‚Ä¢ Use services like UptimeRobot
‚Ä¢ Configure to call webhook at intervals
‚Ä¢ Provides additional monitoring layer

üìà MONITORING:

üìä EXECUTION HISTORY:
‚Ä¢ Check n8n execution log regularly
‚Ä¢ Monitor for failed executions
‚Ä¢ Set up n8n error notifications

üìã LOG REVIEW:
‚Ä¢ Check Google Sheets 'Log' tab
‚Ä¢ Verify timestamps are updating
‚Ä¢ Monitor content changes over time

üö® ERROR HANDLING:
‚Ä¢ All nodes have 'Continue on Error' enabled
‚Ä¢ Failed nodes won't stop the workflow
‚Ä¢ Check individual node outputs for issues

üõ°Ô∏è SECURITY CONSIDERATIONS:

üîê API KEYS:
‚Ä¢ Store all credentials securely in n8n
‚Ä¢ Never hardcode API keys in workflow
‚Ä¢ Regularly rotate API keys

üìß EMAIL SECURITY:
‚Ä¢ Use dedicated email for notifications
‚Ä¢ Consider email filtering rules
‚Ä¢ Monitor for spam/bounce issues

üåê WEBHOOK SECURITY:
‚Ä¢ Consider adding authentication
‚Ä¢ Use HTTPS endpoints only
‚Ä¢ Monitor webhook access logs

üíæ DATA PRIVACY:
‚Ä¢ Regularly clean old log entries
‚Ä¢ Be mindful of scraped content sensitivity

‚ö†Ô∏è COMMON PROBLEMS:

üö´ FIRECRAWL ERRORS:
‚Ä¢ Check API key validity
‚Ä¢ Verify target URL is accessible
‚Ä¢ Check rate limits on Firecrawl account

üìä GOOGLE SHEETS ISSUES:
‚Ä¢ Verify sheet ID and tab names
‚Ä¢ Check OAuth permissions
‚Ä¢ Ensure sheets have correct structure

üìß EMAIL PROBLEMS:
‚Ä¢ Check Gmail API quotas
‚Ä¢ Verify recipient email address
‚Ä¢ Check spam folders

ü™ù WEBHOOK ISSUES:
‚Ä¢ Ensure workflow is activated
‚Ä¢ Check webhook URL format
‚Ä¢ Verify n8n instance is accessible

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
